subclusters.subcluster_name: SASP-Driven Cellular Senescence in Tissue Aging
Replicative Senescence and Telomere-Driven Cellular Senescence Theory

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: SASP-Driven Cellular Senescence in Tissue Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on senescent cells causing tissue dysfunction via SASP, specifically in cardiac aging, highlighting SASP's role in inflammation and remodeling.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: SASP-Driven Cellular Senescence in Tissue Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes accumulation of senescent cells and SASP secretion causing chronic inflammation and tissue dysfunction across multiple tissues.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: SASP-Driven Cellular Senescence in Tissue Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes DNA damage-induced senescence and SASP secretion driving inflammation and tissue remodeling contributing to aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: SASP-Driven Cellular Senescence in Tissue Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights senescence as tumor suppression with SASP-mediated chronic inflammation promoting aging and cancer.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: SASP-Driven Cellular Senescence in Tissue Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Phosphate-induced senescence triggers SASP and inflammation, linking metabolic stress to senescence-driven aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: SASP-Driven Cellular Senescence in Tissue Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes senescence in post-mitotic cells with SASP and mitochondrial dysfunction driving aging phenotypes.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: SASP-Driven Cellular Senescence in Tissue Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on accumulation of senescent cells with SASP causing tissue dysfunction and immune evasion in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: SASP-Driven Cellular Senescence in Tissue Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details dynamic senescence progression and SASP secretion driving chronic inflammation and age-related tissue decline.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: SASP-Driven Cellular Senescence in Tissue Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes irreversible arrest and SASP secretion disrupting tissue microenvironment and promoting aging and cancer.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: SASP-Driven Cellular Senescence in Tissue Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links senescence and SASP to systemic aging and shows energy restriction reduces SASP, reversing aging markers.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: SASP-Driven Cellular Senescence in Tissue Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights senescence-induced SASP affecting stem cell pools and tissue homeostasis, promoting aging and cancer.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: SASP-Driven Cellular Senescence in Tissue Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes SASP-driven inflammation recruiting CD38+ immune cells that degrade NAD+, linking senescence to metabolic aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: RNA Sensing-Mediated Cellular Senescence in Vascular Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on self-RNA sensing by RIG-I in endothelial cells triggering SASP and vascular aging, a distinct RNA-mediated mechanism.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Sphingolipid-Regulated Cellular Senescence in Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes sphingolipid metabolites (ceramide, S1P) regulating senescence and SASP, linking lipid signaling to aging and disease.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Autophagy-Regulated Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Explains dual role of autophagy in promoting or suppressing senescence via SASP regulation and cellular homeostasis.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Autophagy-Regulated Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on age-related autophagy decline causing accumulation of damaged components and promoting senescence and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Autophagy-Regulated Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Shows autophagy decline causally drives aging phenotypes including senescence, with partial reversibility upon restoration.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Stress-Induced Premature Senescence (SIPS) Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes senescence triggered by subcytotoxic stresses independent of telomere shortening, involving oxidative stress and TGF-β1.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Stress-Induced Premature Senescence (SIPS) Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights heterogeneity of senescent states induced by molecular stress, with distinct functional specializations.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: p53-Mediated Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on p53 as central regulator inducing senescence for tumor suppression but also promoting aging phenotypes.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: p53-Mediated Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details p53-p21 and p16-Rb pathways in senescence induction and their dual role in cancer suppression and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Replicative Senescence and Telomere-Driven Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on telomere shortening limiting cell divisions causing replicative senescence, with telomerase modulating this process.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Replicative Senescence and Telomere-Driven Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes finite proliferative capacity due to telomere shortening triggering replicative senescence and cell cycle arrest.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Replicative Senescence and Telomere-Driven Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights intrinsic replicative limit of cells and multiple pathways leading to senescence relevant to organismal aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Replicative Senescence and Telomere-Driven Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details telomere shortening accelerated by oxidative stress triggering p53-dependent replicative senescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Replicative Senescence and Telomere-Driven Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on senescence in dermal fibroblasts with reduced proliferation and extracellular matrix production contributing to aging.
